Regular check-in post, with information about our rules and wikis Welcome to /r/depression's check-in post - a place to take a moment and share what is going on and how you are doing. If you have an accomplishment you want to talk about (these shouldn't be standalone posts in the sub as they violate the "role model" rule, but are welcome here), or are having a tough time but prefer not to make your own post, this is a place you can share.

Our subreddit rules are located in the sidebar (you can also always access them at /r/depression/about/rules) - since all of them exist for important safety reasons, we ask everyone here to read and follow them. Please click 'report' on any harmful content you see here - we always want to know and deal as soon as we can.
We also have several wikis there for help with finding and giving support:
/r/depression/wiki/what_is_depression provides guidance about what is and isn't a depressive disorder, guidance on the complex nature of the illnesses that are usually grouped under the "depression" label, and redirect information for common off-topic issues.
/r/depression/wiki/giving_help offers information on the nature and value of peer support for mental-health issues in general, and lots of guidance for learning what is -- and isn't -- usually helpful in giving peer support.
YSK that the types of rule violations that we most frequently see interfering with people getting safe and relevant support here are:

People breaking the private contact rule. You should never trust anyone who tries to get you into a private conversation in response to a post here. See /r/depression/wiki/private_contact
"I'm here to help" posts. This shows that you don't understand the most basic principles of peer support, especially selectivity. The "giving help" wiki explains more about this.
Role modelling, i.e. "achievement" or "advice" posts. This is an expert-free zone -- that's what peer support means (rule 5). We know that "internet culture" celebrate not just bragging about your achievements but bragging about your good intentions. Nothing like that is ever acceptable here.
Content that's more about 'making a statement' or casually polling the sub than seeking personal support (or, in a comment, giving it) (rules 1, 2 and 10).
Off-topic posts about difficult situations or circumstances, including interpersonal losses. Grief, sadness, anger, and other difficult emotions are not mental illnesses. The "what is depression" wiki has suggestions for other places to post about these issues, which are 100% valid and serious but inappropriate here.
I hate that I catch feelings so quickly, I feel like such an idiot for thinking someone might actually be interested in me.

Me: I know I’ve been limiting my speaking output lately but I still need to shut up more often.
Also me: Then you shouldn’t have written this in the first place.

i'm so tired of pretending everything is okay or pushing my sadness aside. i keep a happy, "stable"  mask on because my parents already have a lot of problems to deal with and they say that i just add onto their issues whenever i express my feelings. i'm exhausted
i'm such a fucking screw up and a failure can someone just fucking hit me with a bus already. why am i even here?
Isolated myself from everyone apart from my family for the past 3 years. And today I'm feeling so hurt that I've avoided my online friends too. I just wish I could stop existing in my sleep.
I wish I wasn't alone right now, I just want to be hugged and told that I matter.

You matter. Every life on this world matters. All of us can take one but none can give one so that's why life is important. You may be alone now but time can and will change everything but you also have just give a little bit of your strenght to achieve that. I don't know you and I won't ever but I can tell you I have seen hell but I was able to get out of there. Hope exists but in this state none of us can see the bright future that awaits them.
I feel so empty and dead. I'm so lonely but can't connect with anyone. Can't even pretend long enough to. I honestly just want to fucking die. I hate myself.

I don't and will never know exactly how you feel but I probably and still expirience many of the things you go through. There is always somewhere help and people who might be able to help you on a professional level. If you can seek them out. Hating yourself gets no one anything. There are so many more people that have done far worse than you, all the child molesters, the murderer, the people who have lied and broken the hearts of others. Hate these criminals that have hurt others but not yourself. I can't help you much but I do want to let you know that there is hope but most of us can't see it when we are in our lowest times. You have cone this far and that is a achievement many others weren't able to get.
